relatedanime.anime: Kuroko no Baske: Winter Cup Soushuuhen

similaranime.anime: Tennis no Ouji-sama: Zenkoku Taikai Hen - Semifinal
Tennis no Ouji-sama: Zenkoku Taikai Hen

anime.description: Seirin High successfully advance to the semifinals of the Winter Cup after winning a fierce game against Yosen High. They continue to aim to become the champions but have to face many powerful opponents along the way.

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: high school
tag.description: A secondary school that usually contains grades 10 through 12 in Japan, or 9 through 12 in America.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: school clubs
tag.description: Even though school clubs in Japan are not mandatory, there is some pressure from the social grid (e.g. fellow students, teachers) to participate in some kind of after-school activity, be it in sports or arts. Colleges also have clubs. As a comedy element in anime, some students have joined too many clubs, and are thus constantly stressed out. There is also the element of social commentary, making it clear that you have to join a club, if you want to be part of the class. Since self-founded clubs need at least 3 members, the desperate search and advertising for new members can be cause for hilarity in anime.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: basketball
tag.description: Basketball is Netball for men, the real game that encourages dribbling and other such uncouth behaviour that was sanitised out of the ladies` version. However, it is itself woozy compared to Ulama, as the losing side are seldom publicly sacrificed.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: funny expressions
tag.description: The facial expressions of the characters may change so quickly or unexpectedly distort that hilarity will ensue.

tag.name: school rivalry
tag.description: Simple description for a "School vs School in all-out physical-combat" series. No matter how geographically close or far apart the schools are, students from different schools are enemies by default and are likely to engage in physical fights on sight (except on the occasion that certain schools form pacts of alliance or peace).

tag.name: competition
tag.description: Some sort of confrontation occurs in this show. The protagonists "duke it out" via various competitions.

tag.name: talking is a free action
tag.description: Time in comics is flexible. Each panel shows a single event, which is usually accompanied by a length of dialog, which must take some time to say. This disparity is usually accepted if it isn`t taken to extremes. But often, characters will exposit when it`s most needed: at the story`s climax, when both the intricacies of the plot and the intensity of action hit their highest. While the Heroes Outrun the Fireball, Mr. Exposition might explain why the Evil Overlord`s death caused the explosion. The Action Girl can deliver impressive lectures on why the monster`s Achilles` Heel will work, while still engaging in Waif-Fu. The Superhero can quip to his heart`s content and explain his abilities while dueling one insignificant mobster, or deliver a Kirk Summation during the course of a single Finishing Move. Sometimes even apparent mere mortals can give a lecture on what is happening when it would be a much better idea to simply run like hell. Without stopping to breathe, apparently. Source: TvTrope

tag.name: hard work and guts
tag.description: One of the character`s motto in the anime. Because there is nothing that cannot be achieved by hard work and guts.

tag.name: ensemble cast
tag.description:
A show with an ensemble cast focuses on a larger group of main characters in a single plot narrative; anime containing several segmented plot narratives (such as episodic or arc-based plots) are excluded. As such, it doesn`t really have a "main" or "lead" character; instead, every member of the central main character group plays an important part in the show`s grander scheme; no single character is more important or prominent than the others (equality of importance). Further, subplots (if any) lead by each character in the ensemble have equal weighting in importance (or lack of weight).
* In a show where no single main character is more important or prominent than the others, 4+ main characters is almost always an ensemble cast. * A show with 3 main characters of equal importance is likely also an ensemble cast; equality of importance must be considered carefully. * A show with 2 main characters of equal importance is generally not an ensemble cast situation; however, on an exception basis where neither main character is considered an antagonist, a 2-main-character anime may be considered an ensemble (e.g. http://anidb.net/a11829 [Kimi no Na wa.]).
Pictured: http://anidb.net/a9043 [K (anime)]

tag.name: tournament
tag.description: A competition involving a large number of participants. Such competitions may range from friendly, moderated sporting events to anything-goes, all-out fights to the death. All participants take part in the tournament in want or need of the final goal and possible prizes; which depending on genre, may range from a boastful record at school to great riches and/or the granting of a wish. Depending on the type of tournament, contestants will either act alone, be permitted a team, or construct a team of chance throughout the ongoing competition.

tag.name: following one`s dream
tag.description: No matter what the hardships may be, at least one of the protagonists in this anime is following her/his dream. Examples: To become a professional athlete, a musician, a painter or the ruler of this world!

tag.name: predominantly male cast
tag.description: The anime features a mostly male cast, i.e. female characters are rare. Example: Reverse harem setting with a plethora of bishounen.

tag.name: rivalry
tag.description: Quite broadly used term describing a conflict, contest, struggle, or opposition of some sort. Typical examples: The mostly comedic rivalry for the love of a protagonist in a harem anime (love polygon), the more "mindless" battles between wannabe delinquents in a school fighting anime, or the struggle between good & evil in an epic conflict for world domination.

character.name: Kagami Taiga
character.description: Kagami is a serious guy who grew up in America till 13. He hates how Japanese students plays basketball but decides to challenge "Kiseki no Sedai" since he believes that "You cant live a life without challenging strong opponents". He starts to hate kuroko since he plays extremely badly, and calls him a "bluff guy". but he changes his mind after seeing his impact in game. He turns on and tries harder when people make fun out of him and call him weak and often laughs when he looses to a strong person. even though he and Kuroko get along, he often starts a fight with him since Kuroko`s calm attitude gets on his nerves.

character.name: Kuroko Tetsuya
character.description: Kuroko (or Kurokochi as Kise calls him) is a short stiff guy who plays basketball worse than any amateur. But, he has one and only talent that makes him invincible: he has a great ability in misdirection and passing the ball, also due to his extremely small size and build (comparing to other players), he often gets ignored and therefore he can "hide" himself behind other regulars and distract them by ball movement so no one will notice he is there. the benefits of his invisible style, (as taiga calls it) makes him able to steal balls from players without them noticing he is around. He is known as the Invisible Phantom sixth of the famous group of middle schoolers, "Kiseki no Sedai". His Weak point is that he looses his effectiveness after 40 minutes and other players will get used to his presence.

character.name: Aida Riko
character.description: Aida is a daughter of a Sports trainer and has great ability in analyzing the body of people. Hyuuga thinks she sees everything in numbers and believes in her techniques so he made her to be the coach of the club.

character.name: Midorima Shintarou
character.description: Shintarou was Kiseki no Sedai`s best shooter, none of his teammates remember him to miss a shoot. He has a high keen to horoscopes and listens to oha saha horoscope every day and carries the lucky item they recommend. He believes that if you try hard, your fate will follow. He shows a huge attention to his fingers and always polishes and adjusts his nails and keeps them bandaged. Despite saying he dislikes Kuroko, he actually cares so deep about him (as his friend says) and always mentions that he highly respects Kuroko`s style of playing. It seems that he envies Kagami for being Kuroko`s new "light".

character.name: Kise Ryouta
character.description: Kise is a stunningly famous guy who was among Kiseki no Sedai. he has a great ability in copying the movement styles of his opponent. He works as a model for magazines due to his height and good looking face. unlike his manly looks, he has a childish manner comparing to his friends in the same age. Kise started basketball in the second year of middle school and is less experienced comparing to other players from Kiseki and claims to be the worst one among them. He shows high respect among Kuroko and feels sorry for him to be among the weak team of Teiko high. He believes that Basketball is the game of Size, but with all these, he tries to convince Kuroko to join their team. His Weak point is that he cant copy Kuroko`s game style and also is unable to do much when he cant see the movements of his opponent

character.name: Momoi Satsuki
character.description: Momoi was the manager of the basketball club in middle school. She has been in love with Kuroko since he gave her his winner ice cream stick.

character.name: Moriyama Yoshitaka
character.description: Moriyama Yoshitaka is Kaijou`s shooting guard.

character.name: Takeuchi Genta
character.description: Takeuchi Genta is the coach of Kaijou High.

character.name: Tsugawa Tomoki
character.description: Tsugawa Tomoki is a player of Seihou High. He is infamous for his pressure defense.

character.name: Kimura Shinsuke
character.description: Kimura Shinsuke is a second-year regular at Shuutoku High.

character.name: Miyaji Kiyoshi
character.description: Miyaji Kiyoshi is a second-year regular at Shuutoku High.

character.name: Nakatani Masaaki
character.description: Nakatani Masaaki is the coach of Shuutoku High School.

character.name: Aomine Daiki
character.description: Daiki Aomine was one of the Generation of Miracles and was former partner/light of Kuroko in Teikou. Seirin suffered their first loss this season because of him. He now plays with Tohou High.

character.name: Murasakibara Atsushi
character.description: Murasakibara Atsushi was the Generation of Miracles` center. He now plays for Yousen High and is competing in the Winter Cup.

character.name: Akashi Seijuurou
character.description: Akashi Seijuurou is the feared captain of the Generation of Miracles. He is the only one the Generation listen to and obey. He now plays with Rakuzan High and is competing in the Winter Cup.

character.name: Wakamatsu Kousuke
character.description: Wakamatsu Kousuke is a center and a regular at Tohou Academy. After Imayoshi`s retirement, he became the captain of the team. Source: Kuroko no Basket Wikia

character.name: Sakurai Ryou
character.description: Sakurai Ryou is Tohou`s shooting guard. He is known as a delusional self-blamer. Source: Kuroko no Basket Wikia

episode.title: 全力でやってるだけなんで
I`m Just Going at Full Strength
Je joue à fond, c`est tout
Zenryoku de Yatteru Dake Nande
episode.summary: Seirin High School makes it into the semifinals of the Winter Cup. They defeated Toô Gakuen, featuring Aomine, and Yosen, featuring Murasakibara, both from the "Generation of Miracles," causing Seirin to be one of the more noticed schools. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: もらっとくわ
I`ll Take This For Now
Je les prends !
Morattokuwa
episode.summary: Only four teams remain in the Winter Cup. However, the day of the semifinal, both Kuroko and Kagami`s basketball shoes fall apart, and they rush to purchase new shoes. However, they can`t find any shoes in Kagami`s size! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ジャマすんじゃねーよ
Don`t You Get In My Way
Dégage de ma route !
Jama Sunja Nee yo
episode.summary: Haizaki`s ability allows him to "steal" any move he sees instead of simply copying it. Unable to use any of their special plays, Kaijo is on the ropes. Even Kise, who possesses numerous moves due to his copy ability, begins running out of moves he can use as the game progresses. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: オレのもんだ
This Is Mine
C`est à moi
Ore no Mon Da
episode.summary: The other semifinal between Kaijo and Fukuda Sogo begins. For Kise, Haizaki is a nemesis that he has not once won against. Being on Teiko Middle School`s starting lineup, Haizaki`s skills were definitely there, but due to his arrogant attitude that ignores the rest of the team, the Kaijo team members feel anger against him. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 真の光
True Light
La véritable lumière
Shin no Hikari
episode.summary: The battle between Seirin and Kaijo finally begins. Seirin tries to secure their victory by striking first, but Kise unexpectedly begins using his Perfect Copy at the start of the game, demonstrating his overwhelming strength. With their start ruined, Seirin`s attacks get them nowhere. The unsteady team must be returned to their feet. Riko calls for a player substitution. Furihata takes Izuki`s place on the court! Though Furihata is nervous playing in such an important game, the substitution produces surprising results... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 笑っちゃいますね
It Makes Me Laugh
J`en rirais presque !
Waracchaimasu ne
episode.summary: During the pre-game warmup, the aces Kise and Kagami take some all-out shots to distract the opposing team. Everyone is excited to play their first official game since their practice game in the spring. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 差し出そう
I Will Offer Them
Je vous les offrirai !
Sashidesou
episode.summary: In the face of Akashi`s "Emperor Eye," which allows his to predict his opponents` future movements, Shutoku seemed powerless, but the fighting spirit returns to the eyes of its members, and they face Rakuzan with an indomitable spirit! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: オレは知らない
I Know None of That
Je n`en connais pas !
Ore wa Shiranai
episode.summary: The first semifinal match is between Shutoku and Rakuzan. The game of fluctuating high level offense and defense changes as it enters the second quarter. Hayama, one of the Uncrowned Kings, and overwhelms Miyaji with his amazing dribbling. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 最高の選手です
He Is the Best Player
S`il y a un joueur ultime...
Saikou no Senshu Desu
episode.summary: Kuroko desperately analyzes the apparently unstoppable Kise`s Perfect Copy and arrives at his answer amidst a series of comebacks. They have only one chance. Sensing Seirin`s resolve, Kise makes his finaly attack, evading Kuroko`s steal by copying Aomine. He passes Kagami by copying Akashi and deals the final blow with Murasakibara`s Thor`s Hammer! However, Izuki`s Eagle Spear deflects the ball...! Which team will advance to the final!? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 今度こそ
This Time, for Sure
Cette fois sera la bonne !
Kondo koso
episode.summary: Kaijo starts catching up when their ace Kise returns to the court, and their desperate effort makes the fans go wild. The entire gymnasium fills with support for Kaijo. Seirin has never experienced such pressure before. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 勝つために
In Order to Win
Pour la victoire !
Katsu Tame ni
episode.summary: The Seirin-Kaijo game enters its second half! Kaijo`s doubleteam is powerless against Kagami`s shockingly rapid growth, and he crushes Kaijo without its ace Kise. Kaijo clings to Seirin, but Seirin is unstoppable and the point gap widens. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ナメんじゃねぇ!!
Don`t Belittle Us!!
Ne nous sous-estimez-pas !
Namenja Nee!!
episode.summary: The Seirin-Kaijo match heats up with an ace showdown. The tables turn, and Seirin takes the offensive. The final awakened one whose abilities rival the Generation of Miracles... Kagami`s talents begin to blossom. Kise senses the threat more keenly than anyone else, but it gives him all the more reason not to lose! However, Kise`s injured foot takes a turn for a worse, and he`s forced to retreat to the bench. Seirin suddenly seems to take control of the game, but without their ace, Kaijo comes together and digs in their heels. Finally, Kasamatsu beats Kuroko`s Phantom Shot that even Murasakibara couldn`t stop! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 青い空の日
A Day with Blue Skies
Un jour de ciel bleu
Aoi Sora no Hi
episode.summary: The night before the final against Rakuzan, Kuroko begins telling the Seirin team about his past with the Generation of Miracles. Though Kuroko joined the distinguished Teiko Middle School basketball team, he placed into the third string. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 勝利ってなんですか?
What Is Victory?
Qu`est-ce que la victoire ?
Shouritte Nandesuka?
episode.summary: Kuroko and his teammates enter their third year of high school and begin preparing for their third national championship, but for the unrivaled Generation of Miracles, winning has become expected. To relieve their boredom, they begin competing to see who can score the most points during official games. Despite their attitude, the team`s overwhelming strength carries them to the national tournament. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 僕らはもう
We No Longer
C`est fini...
Bokura wa Mou
episode.summary: Through the efforts of the Generation of Miracles, Teiko wins the national tournament for the second year in a row. However, they grow stronger and stronger than their opponents. Cracks begin appearing between the overwhelmingly powerful members of the Generation of Miracles as well. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ...ワリィ
...Sorry
Désolé...
...Warii
episode.summary: Kuroko finally joins the first string of the Teiko basketball team and is tasked with mentoring the new recruit Kise. Meanwhile, Nijimura decides to step down from the captain position and names Akashi as his successor. Using a new playstyle centered around Akashi, Teiko racks up the victories at the national middle school tournament. However, Aomine`s unparalleled skill makes him lose motivation. Meanwhile, Kuroko is reunited with his friend Ogiwara Shigehiro... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 覚悟の重さ
Weight of Resolve
La volonté d`être une ombre
Kakugo no Omosa
episode.summary: The Seirin-Rakuzan game enters the third quarter. Seirin continues to place their hope in their scorers Hyuga and Kagami. However, Akashi tries to nip their glimmer of hope. Hyuga is his target. When Mibuchi`s "Earth" shot turns Hyuga`s aggression against him and Hyuga receives another foul, he receives a fourth when he argues with the referee. Admist Seirin`s desperate situation, Kuroko returns to the court. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 奇跡は起きない
A Miracle Will Not Happen
Il n`y aura pas de miracle
Kiseki wa Okinai
episode.summary: Mayuzumi`s mysterious power finally becomes clear. With the same qualities as Kuroko, he uses misdirection as a weapon as Rakuzan`s "Phantom Sixth Man." Additionally, the "new model" is even good enough to make shots on his own. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 最高じゃねーの?
Isn`t It the Best?
On ne peut pas rêver mieux, non ?
Saikou Janeeno?
episode.summary: Fearing Kagami will run out of stamina when he enters the zone, Riko pulls Kuroko off the court, strengthens the defense with second years, and tells Kagami to focus on offense. However, Akashi chooses to mark Kagami, and he even stops Kagami`s in the zone attacks with his Emperor Eye. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決勝戦試合開始[ファイナルティップオフ]!!
Final Tip-Off!
L`ultime Tip-Off !
Final Tip-Off!!
episode.summary: After hearing about Kuroko`s experience at Teiko Middle School the previous night, the members of Seirin rise the next morning ready to face the championship game. Players from all schools gather at the stadium to witness the final day of the Winter Cup. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: お前だったんじゃねーか
So It Was You
C`était donc toi ?
Omae Dattanjaneeka
episode.summary: Akashi is awakened by a conversation with himself. He apologizes to his teammates and asks to be put back in the game. When the Generation of Miracles see him play, they know he`s returned to his former self. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 諦めませんか
Why Don`t We Give Up?
Pourquoi ne pas laisser tomber ?
Akiramemasenka
episode.summary: Abandoning his teammates, Akashi enters the Zone and begins handling both offense and defense by himself. When Kagami becomes paralyzed in the face of such overwhelming strength, Kuroko suggests they work together against Akashi. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 忠告だ
A Warning
Ceci est un avertissement
Chuukoku Da
episode.summary: The game enters the final quarter! The ten minutes that will determine the champions of the Winter Cup have begun. Having found a way to stop Mibuchi through Koganei`s play, Hyuga returns to the court while carrying the risk of a fifth foul to challenge Mibuchi once again! As though inspired by Hyuga`s resolve, Kiyoshi dominates Nebuya with all his might and gets rebound after rebound. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: これでも必死だよ
In My Own Way, I`m Desperate
Je suis au taquet, là !
Koredemo Hisshi Da yo
episode.summary: Through Kagami`s wide-range defense and Kuroko stopping Mayuzumi, Seirin regains its hope. However, it`s not enough to close the gap. They must stop the attacks of the Uncrowned Kings to change their situation. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 何度でも
Many Times Over
Autant de fois que tu voudras !
Nandodemo
episode.summary: Entering the true Zone, the united team of Seirin begins catching up to Rakuzan. However, with only 40 seconds remaining, the end of the game approaches. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 最高のプレゼントです
The Greatest Present
Saikou no Present Desu
episode.summary: A few weeks after the Winter Cup, the five players of the Generation of Miracles as well as Kuroko have settled back into everyday life. But an invitation from Momoi arrives, proposing that the former Teikō Junior High players gather once again and play a game. Source: crunchyroll
